intro: Lellingeria jimenezii, commonly known as the Jimenez's lantana, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in coastal and dry forest habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
